briefdescription.para: The Slider can be moved horizontally between left and right.
The Slider can be moved vertically between top and bottom.
Values that represent slider orientations.
The background image.
The backgroundSelected image.
The backgroundSelected view port. Controls the visible part of the backgroundSelected image.
The current value represented by the slider.
The indicator image.
The maximum position of the indicator (either x coordinate in horizontal mode or y coordinate in vertical mode)
The minimum position of the indicator (either x coordinate in horizontal mode or y coordinate in vertical mode)
The new value callback (called when the indicator is moved)
The selected slider orientation.
The start value callback (called when an interaction with the indicator is initiated)
The stop value callback (called when an interaction with the indicator ends)
The value range max.
The value range min.
Gets indicator maximum previous set using setupHorizontalSlider() or setupVerticalSlider().
Gets indicator minimum previously set using setupHorizontalSlider() or setupVerticalSlider().
Gets the maximum value previously set using setValueRange().
Gets the minimum value previously set using setValueRange().
Gets the current value represented by the indicator.
Sets all the bitmaps for the Slider.

detaileddescription.para: The Slider shows the sliderBackgroundSelected bitmap in the region of the Slider that is selected, that is the area to the left of the indicator for a horizontal Slider and below the indicator for a vertical Slider. The sliderBackground is shown on the other side of the Slider. To ignore this effect simply use the same bitmap for both the sliderBackground and the sliderBackgroundSelected.

parameterdescription.para: The slider background with the slider range unselected.
The slider background with the slider range selected.
The indicator.

memberdef.argsstring: (const BitmapId sliderBackground, const BitmapId sliderBackgroundSelected, const BitmapId indicator)
memberdef.name: setBitmaps

briefdescription.para: Sets all the bitmaps for the Slider.

detaileddescription.para: The Slider shows the sliderBackgroundSelected bitmap in the region of the Slider that is selected, that is the area to the left of the indicator for a horizontal Slider and below the indicator for a vertical Slider. The sliderBackground is shown on the other side of the Slider. To ignore this effect simply use the same bitmap for both the sliderBackground and the sliderBackgroundSelected.

parameterdescription.para: The slider background with the slider range unselected.
The slider background with the slider range selected.
The indicator.

briefdescription.para: Associates an action to be performed when the slider changes its value.

parameterdescription.para: The callback to be executed. The callback will be given a reference to the Slider and the current value of the slider.

briefdescription.para: Associates an action to be performed when an interaction with the slider is initiated (click or drag).

parameterdescription.para: The callback to be executed. The callback will be given a reference to the Slider and the current value of the slider at interaction start.

briefdescription.para: Associates an action to be performed when an interaction with the slider ends (click or drag).

parameterdescription.para: The callback to be executed. The callback will be given a reference to the Slider and the current value of the slider at interaction end.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t backgroundX, uint16_t backgroundY, uint16_t indicatorY, uint16_t indicatorMinX, uint16_t indicatorMaxX)
memberdef.name: setupHorizontalSlider

briefdescription.para: Sets up the slider in horizontal mode with the range going from the left to right.

detaileddescription.para: Places the backgrounds and the indicator inside the Slider container. It is possible to place the end points of the indicator outside the background image if it needs to go beyond the boundaries of the background. The width and height of the Slider will be adjusted appropriately so that both the background and the indicator will be fully visible in both the minimum and maximum indicator positions.
Calls setValue() with the current value (default 0) and triggers the newSliderValue callback.

parameterdescription.para: The background x coordinate inside the slider.
The background y coordinate inside the slider.
The indicator y coordinate inside the slider.
The indicator minimum x coordinate inside the slider. This is the position used when the slider is at its minimum value. Must be less than indicatorMaxX.
The indicator maximum x coordinate inside the slider. This is the position used when the slider is at its maximum value. Must be greater than indicatorMinX.

simplesect.para: The x and y position of the Slider will either be the left/top of the background or the left/top of the indicator in its minimum x coordinate.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t backgroundX, uint16_t backgroundY, uint16_t indicatorX, uint16_t indicatorMinY, uint16_t indicatorMaxY)
memberdef.name: setupVerticalSlider

briefdescription.para: Sets up the slider in vertical mode with the range going from the bottom to top.

detaileddescription.para: Places the backgrounds and the indicator inside the Slider container. It is possible to place the end points of the indicator outside the background image if it needs to go beyond the boundaries of the background. The width and height of the Slider will be adjusted appropriately so that both the background and the indicator will be fully visible in both the minimum and maximum indicator positions.
Calls setValue with the current value (default 0) and triggers the newSliderValue callback.

parameterdescription.para: The background x coordinate inside the slider.
The background y coordinate inside the slider.
The indicator x coordinate inside the slider.
The indicator minimum y coordinate inside the slider. This is the position used when the slider is at its maximum value. Must be less than indicatorMaxX.
The indicator maximum y coordinate inside the slider. This is the position used when the slider is at its minimum value. Must be greater than indicatorMinX.

simplesect.para: The x and y position of the Slider will either be the left/top of the background or the left/top of the indicator in its minimum y coordinate.

briefdescription.para: Places the indicator at the specified value relative to the specified value range.

detaileddescription.para: Values beyond the value range will be rounded to the min/max value in the value range.

parameterdescription.para: The value.

simplesect.para: The value update triggers a newSliderValue callback just as a drag or click does.

If the value range is larger than the number of pixels specified for the indicator min and indicator max, some values will not be represented by the slider and thus is not possible to set with this method. In this case the value will be rounded to the nearest value that is represented in the current setting.

briefdescription.para: Sets the value range of the slider.

detaileddescription.para: Values accepted and returned by the slider will be in this range.
The slider will set its value to the specified new value.

parameterdescription.para: The minimum value. Must be less than maxValue.
The maximum value. Must be greater than minValue.
The new value.

simplesect.para: If the range is larger than the number of pixels specified for the indicator min and max some values will not be represented by the slider.

briefdescription.para: Sets the value range of the slider.

detaileddescription.para: Values accepted and returned by the slider will be in this range.
The slider will set its value to the current value or round to minValue or maxValue if the current value is outside the new range.

parameterdescription.para: The minimum value. Must be less than maxValue.
The maximum value. Must be greater than minValue.

simplesect.para: If the range is larger than the number of pixels specified for the indicator min and indicator max, some values will not be represented by the slider.

briefdescription.para: Gets the indicator position range, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: the difference between max and min for the position of the indicator.

briefdescription.para: Gets the indicator radius, which is half the size of the indicator.
Gets the value range, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: the difference between max and min for the value range.

briefdescription.para: Defines the event handler interface for ClickEvents.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementation ignores the event. The event is only received if the Drawable is touchable and visible.

parameterdescription.para: The ClickEvent received from the HAL.

briefdescription.para: Defines the event handler interface for DragEvents.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementation ignores the event. The event is only received if the drawable is touchable and visible.

parameterdescription.para: The DragEvent received from the HAL.

briefdescription.para: Translate a position (x coordinate in horizontal mode and y in vertical mode) in the indicator position range to the corresponding value in the value range.

parameterdescription.para: The position.

simplesect.para: The value that corresponds to the coordinate.

briefdescription.para: Updates the indicator position described by position.

detaileddescription.para: Calls the newSliderValueCallback with the new value.

parameterdescription.para: The position (x coordinate in horizontal mode and y coordinate in vertical mode).

briefdescription.para: Translate a value in the value range to the corresponding position in the indicator position range (x coordinate in horizontal mode and y in vertical mode).

parameterdescription.para: The value.

simplesect.para: The coordinate that corresponds to the value.

briefdescription.para: A slider is a graphical element with which the user may set a value by moving an indicator on a slider, or simply by clicking the slider.

detaileddescription.para: The slider can operate in horizontal or vertical mode. The slider has two bitmaps. One bitmap is used on one side of the indicator. The other is used on the other side. They can be used in indicating the part of the slider value range that is currently selected.
The slider operates on an integer value range that can be set by the user.
